description: From Middle English afferen, aferen, from Old French aferer, afuerer, afeurer, aforer, from Medieval Latin afforƒÅre.

verbs.description: affeer (third-person singular simple present affeers, present participle affeering, simple past and past participle affeered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete, law) To assess or reduce an arbitrary penalty or amercement to a precise sum; to fix the market value of.
